question: Which of the following is true regarding the AWS availability zones and edge locations?
options: Edge locations are located in separate Availability Zones worldwide to serve global customers.
An availability zone exists within an edge location to distribute content globally with low latency.
An Availability Zone is a geographic location where AWS provides multiple, physically separated and isolated edge locations.
An AWS Availability Zone is an isolated location within an AWS Region, however edge locations are located in multiple cities worldwide.
correctAnswer: An AWS Availability Zone is an isolated location within an AWS Region, however edge locations are located in multiple cities worldwide.

explanation.whyCorrect: An AWS Availability Zone is an isolated location within an AWS Region, however edge locations are located in multiple cities worldwide. is the correct answer because it best addresses the requirements stated in the question.
explanation.whyOthersWrong: "Edge locations are located in separate Availability Zones worldwide to serve global customers." is incorrect because it does not address the question requirements or is not the appropriate solution for this scenario. "An availability zone exists within an edge location to distribute content globally with low latency." is incorrect because it does not address the question requirements or is not the appropriate solution for this scenario. "An Availability Zone is a geographic location where AWS provides multiple, physically separated and isolated edge locations." is incorrect because it does not address the question requirements or is not the appropriate solution for this scenario.
explanation.additionalPoints: This question tests your understanding of AWS services, concepts, and best practices. Key concepts to review include: AWS service use cases, architectural patterns, cost optimization strategies, and security best practices. Make sure to understand the differences between similar services and when to use each one.
explanation.bestPractices: AWS best practices to remember: (1) Always design for failure and implement high availability across multiple Availability Zones or Regions, (2) Implement the principle of least privilege for security, (3) Use managed services when possible to reduce operational overhead, (4) Monitor costs and set up billing alerts, and (5) Follow the AWS Well-Architected Framework principles.

question: Why are Serverless Architectures more economical than Server-based Architectures?
options: Serverless Architectures use new powerful computing devices.
With the Server-based Architectures, compute resources continue to run all the time but with serverless architecture, compute resources are only used when code is being executed.
When you reserve serverless capacity, you will get large discounts compared to server reservation.
With Serverless Architectures you have the ability to scale automatically up or down as demand changes.
correctAnswer: With the Server-based Architectures, compute resources continue to run all the time but with serverless architecture, compute resources are only used when code is being executed.
